definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
(bird species of China) lowland white-eye (Zosterops meyeni)
see 近地軌道|近地轨道[jin4 di4 gui3 dao4]

sentences.english: The lower field already well prepared for sowing.
sentences.chinese: 低地田已经准备好下种来季作物了。

sentences.english: Most of the country"s population lives in this central lowland.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人口都居住在中心低地。

sentences.english: Finally, it means English belongs with the dialects of the lowlands in the West Germanic area.
sentences.chinese: 最后，英语属于低地的西日尔曼人的区域里的方言。

sentences.english: The low land should be ridged before they are used.
sentences.chinese: 低地在使用前应先整成交替的垄和沟。

sentences.english: Large-scale urban or industrial growth is cramped by the small, local lowlands.
sentences.chinese: 大型城市或工业增长逼仄的地方小型低地。

sentences.english: Glenkinchie and Rosebank are Lowlands single malt Scotch whiskies .
sentences.chinese: 它们是苏格兰低地纯麦威士忌。

sentences.english: Many square miles of land in this low-lying country have been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 这个低地国家已经填海开拓出许多平方英里的土地。

sentences.english: Then he would bring them back to the low lands after the harvest was over.
sentences.chinese: 然后在收割期结束以后他再把鹿群带回低地。

sentences.english: Species in the tropical lowlands are vulnerable too.
sentences.chinese: 热带低地的物种也很脆弱。

definition: low and unhurried (voice etc)/low and gently sloping (terrain)
Andes mountain chain of South America
